website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and adjustable, this aluminum easel is designed for plein air painting out in nature.
pros: Folds up to a very small size for transport
Legs adjust separately so that it can accommodate uneven ground
A spring-loaded clamp keeps canvas secure, which is an especially nice feature when painting in the field
cons: Users note issues with stability, but that is a trade-off for its lightweight design

customer_reviews.title: Artists easel Ohulu Filed Easel
customer_reviews.text: This is my first easel. Very easy to set up use and takes a little space stay at the corner, weight light and very fitting lady to bring out . ! I bought a big supply can get more practices , My class begin on 13th then i will study for hold year !
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Light, compact, easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I like this Artist Easel, two three reasons. First, it is very light weighted comparing the easel made of wood, second it is very easy to set up and fold, and very compact, convenient to take it with you to go anywhere, third, the adjustable legs can fit uneven surface, less strict requirement of the standing surface condition.
customer_reviews.author: A bike ride lover

customer_reviews.title: Nice easel
customer_reviews.text: Nice easel, easy to assemble and lightweight even kid can easily move it around. Before getting the easel, I have to clip the canvas to the chair, and hard to adjust the height. Now, everything goes so easy. Like it and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Yuqian D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality AND Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice easel tripod. Honestly I was really just looking for the cheapest one I could find that looked decent. Without really doing any research, I ordered this one. I have no regrets on the purchase since it’s very easy to set up and is adjustable to several different heights. I would highly recommend this easel to anybody who is a beginner or just looking for something cheap, but effective!
customer_reviews.author: Amber McGraw

customer_reviews.title: Good art stand
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I am looking for when my daughter need one for her painting class. it works very well and I can ajust the hight easily. It is also very sturdy and has no issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in great condition. No instructions and the ones on the description are hard to read from a mobile device. Not a very sturdy stand but for the price, the individual bags for each one and the looks are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Aleya Signor

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: This easel is exactly what I needed for our family pictionary game nights. It folds up nicely and comes with a storage bag. It is light weight and easy to set up. It is tall enough and sturdy enough to withstand our vigorous drawing during our games. I would recommend this for your easel needs.
customer_reviews.author: Beckaroon

customer_reviews.title: Love! Love!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this easel because I needed something adjustable for my dry erase board. It worked out great. It is pretty sturdy, and it can adjust to different angles. I'm glad i bought it.
customer_reviews.author: perpetua

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Events!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, all parts slip inside each other to become very small so that I can pack it in my suitcase and take it with me for events. I used it to hang a banner on and intend to use it for whiteboard discussions and workshops. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: McCartney Green

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of what you order online.
customer_reviews.text: I am pissed I needed this easel for tomorrow and one of the pieces will not tighten up to hold the art work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and portable
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I already own my white board and just needed a stand for my presentations. It did not come with any instructions but I found my way through by going back to the pictures online. Very simple and stable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Super light weight but sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Super lightweight but sturdy! It is just what I wanted: an easel that will allow me to paint table top or coffee table top, bit with the option to paint standing or from a barstool. The lightweight aluminum is easy to clean. The clamps are plastic. The bottom running board frame is adjustable. Extra hardware screws from the adjustable bottom track are included. Comes with a thin vinyl zippered case for storage or if you want to take it to the park to paint landscape. The price is right too.
customer_reviews.author: Texas KnowHow

customer_reviews.title: All 4 easels would not properly adjust to hold a canvas. Disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.text: So I think I got a bad batch because each of the 4 has a part that won’t adjust properly to hold the canvas. Not impressed with the quality of these easels. I bought these as a Mother’s Day gift for my wife because she has taken a liking to painting. Since the Covid situation has us in lockdown, we couldn’t go do a painting with a twist so I thought I’d make up something similar at home for the famiy. I was quickly disappointed when I was trying to put these together and they wouldn’t work right so it didn’t exactly help my plan. Hopefully no everyone will have the same problem I had.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: This is trash dont buy... there is a reason its priced so cheap compared to the others
customer_reviews.author: MEL

customer_reviews.title: Worst Easel EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: This easel is horrible. The aluminum is to light to stay steady. The legs actually flex a bit while your painting making it extremely frustrating when trying to make precise strokes. If you rest your hand on any part of the easel, it moves. Just placing your brush to the canvas and giving any pressure moves the easel. The feet also slide on my wood floor. That can be fixed though with a little duct tape.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Smith

customer_reviews.title: Horizontal holder slants way forward, so it can’t hold anything.
customer_reviews.text: The bar slopes so far forward that it won’t hold anything. There doesn’t appear to be any way to straighten it. The box included instructions on how to put it together, but no mention of securing the bar other than just hanging it on the screws, which causes the slant. Also, there is a length of strap with Velcro on it and no mention of what that is for or how or why to attach it to what.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando James

customer_reviews.title: Ok but already broken
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE -- I have to say that this seller has EXCELLENT customer service! After reading my review they contacted me to make things better! Really like that they went out of their way to fix things even with added hiccups! It took the pandemic for us to finally take this out of the box and put it into use. Somehow the instructions were lost so had to figure out how to get the bottom tray thing on. It works great but a one of the tighteners (I know it's not a word) has already broken after only two uses.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle W

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this arrived cracked in 2 places. It wasn't a big deal since it still held my canvases & really wasnt worth the hassle of sending it back. However you should know that this is CHEAPLY made! It is so lightweight that one drop it will most likely break into a thousand pieces. The plastic on it is super thin and is not durable. I wish I would have read into the reviews a little more before purchasing because I totally would not have bought this one. Be Aware! If the seller decides to refund me some, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful addition to my mobile art station. I needed something that broke down completely but sturdy enough to paint on but light enough to move room to move. It’s really easy to use and put together. You can make it as tall and as short as you would like.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good for lightweight posters only
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review. At first, I said this product is cheap and not stable, but I was a bit harsh. It's actually made well enough for the price, it's just very lightweight and can't handle larger or heavier displays (even though it expands to accommodate larger sizes). If you're planning on displaying a typical cardstock poster, you're good; you have my blessing (haha). If you're wanting to display something heavier than that, don't buy this. It will lose its balance too easily. Also, their customer service is exceptional--this is a company that truly cares.
customer_reviews.author: Stepharoo

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, holds well, takes very little space
customer_reviews.text: This is a okay easel. There is no bad meaning to it. For the price I paid, I am actually kinda satisfied with it. It stands well most of the time, but it could be a little shaky sometimes, which is fine for me. I once put a 30x40 canvas on it, it holds well, but I think it is kinda too big for it. I think any canvas smaller than 30x40 would be perfect for this easel. It is easy to install as well. I mean, for the price, it does its job well. and! It takes very little space :)
customer_reviews.author: MEITop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for what it is
customer_reviews.text: This particular easel stand is very well made but you must understand that it is of very lightweight material and may not be quite as capable as one might imagine. It will hold up a display or a sign but is not appropriate for use for say a heavy chalkboard or anything you need to stay solidly still while you draw on it. The company was outstanding as far as dealing with them when I reached out. I would highly recommend this product for anyone needing a lightweight easel or light duty easel, and I would recommend Ohuhu in general as someone to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, had a problem but customer support fixed it.
customer_reviews.text: * Update * Customer support was very fast and offered me a replacement. I really enjoyed the easel so I was happy to receive the new one, which came very quickly. The easel was good, while it lasted. Was underwhelmed when it didn't even last a year. I use a small wooden board on the easel and that somehow made the back leg break under tension. The tear at the top base made it so the back leg would slide all the way down, it is no longer usable. Semi-regular usage was enough to stress the metal. Overall good product until its disappointing demise.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lynn

customer_reviews.title: This is a OK product if you're a "starving" artist and can't afford a real WOOD easel.
customer_reviews.text: The product is just OK. Easy to assemble; although difficult to adjust. Directions would have been nice. I believe the frame is questionable for a semi/to heavy canvass. I bought it to hold up a foam board sign...... IT WILL DO. I believe frequently changing canvases would be a real pain. If I were a serious artist, I would jump for a more costly quality wood or heavier- metal frame - easel. I believe, I pretty much got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: George Brannen

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, love using it for tabletop painting
customer_reviews.text: I could not figure out how to put this together and had to look it up online. Once I got it together, I loved it. I have only used it as a tabletop so far. I have not even clipped my canvases in the top and it is sturdy enough for me to use with no complaints. I do think it may be a little more wobbly if extended to the full height, but I think it would still be ok to paint on for me. I would probably be hesitant to use it outside in a lot of wind or with anything really heavy. It is perfect for me painting canvases.
customer_reviews.author: BAESC87

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this easel to use for my wedding, to display a sign (never ended up using it though). It's easy to assemble, is lightweight, and you can adjust it to various heights and angles. It's not the prettiest looking easel but is functional. The bag it comes with just barely fits the easel- i wish it was bit roomier so that it's easier to put the easel in. Overall, it's a good purchase and I'll use it when I paint on canvases.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It was a great buy for our 11 yo as a starter easel. But as we were putting it up for her to use, it didn't want to hold the drawing paper properly. There was a piece missing on one side of the leg, so it didn't want to stand correctly. It isn't something we couldn't fix, no need to send it back. She loved it and it using it. The company contacted me after the review and sent us a brand new one. We set it up and it works great. All the pieces and parts were in working condition; therefore, we did not have to “fix” any piece.
customer_reviews.author: Karrie

customer_reviews.title: USED PRODUCTS....BEWARE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just LOVE waiting for a product that I think is new! You can't beat having piece fall out the bag ...sweet! Now would you take a look at how nice these scuff marks are....outstanding!....SMH
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: To start, it was days late arriving. Then it’s Super flimsy and back leg barely holds the weight of the easel, let alone the canvas. Next for real, please put in your product description that it does NOT fit small canvases. Unless there’s some way of maneuvering the spring clip lower than the securing clip that nothing in the instructions or online seems to mention, then I’m really really disappointed. I’ve got a 12x12 in front of me and that’s too small to be secured into the easel. I’m frustrated to say the least. The reviews say small canvases work with this easel but I’m either not seeing how, or they just don’t.
customer_reviews.author: Christine T Sims

customer_reviews.title: A nice re-purposed easel!
customer_reviews.text: I meant to have a better painting experience with this easel, but turned out it works even better for kiddos’ distance learning at the moment! Just mount the iPad on it and there you go. Easy to adjust the height, and the tripod stands firmly. If you are thinking about mounting your iPad on the wall for your kids’ zoom class, def try this one before you break your wall.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Not the most stable; when telescoped the legs can still move outwards. Maybe would move around less if the feet had a wider base than they do. Good value if you’re looking for something to hold a poster board or a press board canvas. Not good for wooden framed stretch canvas. The lip that holds the edge of the canvas is not deep at all, maybe a 1/2” deep. I lowered the back leg and this allowed my framed canvas to sit on top of the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and Difficult
customer_reviews.text: I guess for the money it works okay, but it takes a relatively long time to assemble properly. There are about 5-6 moving parts that all need to be lined up and arranged properly, and even then it is impossible to make the whiteboard level. It also just isn't heavy enough to stay still when writing on it. My wife and I would have much rather invested in spending more for a heavier easel.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brule

customer_reviews.title: It's not something I would recommend for painters
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and held a 23x35 inch chalkboard that I had for a sign at a birthday party. It's not something I would recommend for painters. Just a good support for a stationary, non-interactive display.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great price, very sturdy, adjustable!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a portrait at a funeral. Worked great! I misread the size of portrait it held so it was not quite big enough but we were able to improvise and still use it. I loved the fact you could adjust it from table top all the way to floor setting. It was sturdy and light. Love the caring case and folding up feature. Makes it easy to haul around.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use; holds really well
customer_reviews.text: This easel is perfect for displaying art or posters. We use it for trade shows to hold large images on foam boards. It is compact and unfolds easily which is great because we already have a lot of carry. What I like best is that this easel has a top holder so that when we are outdoor, light breezes don’t blow off the poster.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Chau

customer_reviews.title: Not Flip Chart Quality
customer_reviews.text: Does not and will not hold flip chart pads. The spring on the top isn’t strong enough to clamp to hold. Good only for putting canvas boards or something with a more sturdy backing. Good thing my wife paints and has claimed it, otherwise I’d be returning today!
customer_reviews.author: B. Winckler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! I had some issues with setting it up ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I had some issues with setting it up at first but I'm just a rookie so that's expected. Afterward it is very sturdy. It kinda slide on a wooden surface so keep that in mind, it doesn't slide that much though just when you push it too much. I would put newspaper down for friction and to not cover the floor with paint. :)
customer_reviews.author: Great Ingvar

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: It can hold the white board that I needed for my classroom. I just wish it had somewhere to put my markers on it! That would be a cool feature. The ledge for the board blocks where I normally have my markers sitting but it's such a small detail that it isn't something I feel is a big miss. A great product. Exactly what I was looking for. I like that it's super easy to assemble to small enough to store away if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a budding artist
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice easel. The options for having it on a table or on the ground are a nice touch. The clip at the top makes it easy to make sure your artwork isn't going anywhere while you are working on it. The one downside is that it is very lightweight so you have to be mindful of how much pressure you are putting on your pieces as you are working on them, but that is a minor detail.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: VERY lightweight - not for flip charts, recording or any other heavier duty purposes
customer_reviews.text: VERY lightweight - not particularly sturdy. If you're looking for a display easel or something for an extremely light activity (painting, maybe) then this might be a good choice. If you want it for anything sturdier, like holding a flip chart or recording, this one probably won't do much for you. Love that it's small and compact and has a bag, but ended up returning it because it's pretty flimsy and won't last long for my purposes. Was expecting better weight or quality based on description.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Very light and portable
customer_reviews.text: Not super sturdy, but it is wonderfully light , portable and affordable. Great beater to take out in the parks and quiet corners of the city and do some painting on. 1/3 the cost Same stand @ box store Tip: hang a purse or back bag from it with a carabiner in the middle once it is placed to help anchor it. It is light and wind may ruin your experience if you don't set it up and weigh it down a little.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: Great easel
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it, I positioned all three legs to the same height. But the easel and painting were at risk of falling over! Then I realized the back leg has to be shorter. Maybe a penetrating glimpse into the obvious for others, but it wasn't apparent at first to me!! I love that it can fold down into the case for portability and storage. My other wood easel (cheap) just took up too much space and wobbled too much when painting.
customer_reviews.author: Mindful Meditation

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Mom
customer_reviews.text: I sent this to my 80 something year old Mom and she was able to assemble it like a pro with no help. She said she likes the carrying bag, that it’s lightweight, she can easily adjust the height and is perfect for her acrylic painting on canvas. This made me happy 😃
customer_reviews.author: Moni

customer_reviews.title: Good to travel with
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday because he wanted to try and get back into painting but wanted an easel that was easy to travel with. It is compact, lightweight and adjustable. He likes that he can use it in top of a table or free standing. The only issue he has had with it is that 1 of the screws does not screw in correctly (too loose), so the ledge in which you stand your canvas on isn't level.
customer_reviews.author: Shibz

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a great product and even greater customer service
customer_reviews.text: The easel tripod itself is very lightweight and sturdy however the horizontal bar that the painting sits on can become a little filmsy if the attachment screws don't screw on well which is what happened to mine. However, I have to compliment the great customer service that sent me a brand new easel when all I requested was a part replacement. They went above and beyond to reach out to me when I did not reply immediately. Five star service and product.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Pe

customer_reviews.title: Overall good but could be sturdier
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quick. It's very light and easy to carry around. Very easy to assemble as well. I am 5'4 in height and when I raise the easel to its maximum height, it towers over me by a couple of inches. The only drawback is that it's very flimsy being so light. I used it indoors for painting but I think if I did take it outdoors, a small gust of wind will most definitely topple it!
customer_reviews.author: PGriffin

customer_reviews.title: Not good for functional use.
customer_reviews.text: Got this with the intention of having a lighter easel to take around with me. But it quickly became “storage”; I only use it to display or dry pieces. It’s not sturdy: the legs don’t stay extended (the clasps don’t function well), and the tray to support your media (canvas/paper/etc) wiggles a lot and doesn’t sit balanced. Not good for functional use.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Preston

customer_reviews.title: Simple design
customer_reviews.text: Was decently simple to assemble, pretty sturdy. Only cons is that you have to take the tray off and unscrew the holder to slide it up and down to reposition it, you can't collapse the 2 arms that hold the tray while the tray is in position but other that that it's fine. If you don't need to move it frequently it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Crystelle Phomphansy

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: Super flimsy and cheap - it isn't stable, it broke after about 5 minutes of use with a whiteboard. They did send me a replacement and have very attentive customer service. I am using a more sturdy easel for my whiteboard, but am trying the replacement on lighter things, and it seems to hold up fine. I wouldn't suggest this product for heavier items, but if it's for something light it's pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: David Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Received a Used product and was dirty
customer_reviews.text: Received a used product and was very delicate. Not sealed, covers were torn inside, even the string was severely worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: Decent; does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent easel on a budget. It is sometimes less than sturdy. Can hold my 18x24 inch newsprint pad, reasonably.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, very functional.
customer_reviews.text: This has turned out to be a great product period. It is really easy to setup up. The design is extremely clever and functional . For the money it is a terrific value period I do not know how long is this going to last but at the price it is an excellent buy. If it breaks I shall buy another. For plein air it's been terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Diane A. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Check the content on arrival for defects immediately
customer_reviews.text: We ordered 6 packages, 4 in each box. We found three were the sidebar could not screw in, was blunt thread. They replaced it and the replacement had one plastic clip broken, we have returned. Once refund is processed, we will reorder. Having said that, these are pretty good in quality and usability.
customer_reviews.author: HK

customer_reviews.title: It’s well made and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: First of all this is the sturdiest ,most well made ,(cheap) easel I have ever had! This is literally the best you can get for a cheap price . If you want something perfect go buy a wood easel. But it hold up and has so many adjustments. I’m 5’9” and it’s tall enough for me to paint standing.I can even adjust it for sitting. I don’t have any complaints except it doesn’t have instructions. So if you haven’t had an easel before just look up online how to set it up .
customer_reviews.author: Msim9

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Portable Lightweight Sturdy Affordable Adjustable Cons: Does not fit a tri-fold presentation board. My solution? Velcro! I used Velcro to secure my board to the easel at the top. Presentation boards sit plumb and not at a 45 degree angle. Not necessarily a con for me for what I specifically bought it for, but this can limit it's capabilities. Uses: I'm currently use it to hold a board to create a "wall" as I conduct business via video conferences. I work from an open space and needed something to create a room-like atmosphere. I also bought this with the intent to travel and work as I do so.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Customer

customer_reviews.title: portable, adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for this kind of stand, the good thing about this product is it can adjust the heighth, so it's both good on the desk and the floor, and it is light, so it is convenient to bring outside. One thing that I am not so satisfied is the weight actually, it is too light makes it not so stable as the wooden ones, however, it is still a good choice after all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Worthy product
customer_reviews.text: This Easel is worth the price forsure, it's easy to assemble and use. I used it to put up a 16×20 canvas outside in the backyard for a party and it stayed up all night without dropping the canvas. Easy to store come with the back just push in all the sides and fold it...love the product, easy to carry it around when you travel
customer_reviews.author: Margi P.

customer_reviews.title: good for light work
customer_reviews.text: This easel is good for light work. Though the top clip gets in the way of painting, it's not a big deal if you decide not to use it, and instead just rest the canvas against the center pole. So far it's held up to my usage. It's easy to assemble and use, and when you do use the top clip, it holds the canvas securely
customer_reviews.author: Synyster_wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great but no set up instructions.
customer_reviews.text: There is a review on here that says it's only 3 feet off the ground. I think he isn't extending the legs all the way because it clearly extends to a standing level. The only thing it doesn't come with instructions so I'm left trying to figure out how the bottom bar is supposed to be attached securely? Other than that its perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AMLJade

customer_reviews.title: Van Gogh and Rembrandt approved! ;)
customer_reviews.text: I've had this easel quite awhile now and love it! It's lightweight, compact, and perfect for use at home and out and about. The only thing I don't like about it is the clip at the "top" meant to clip a canvas down. It's awkward, but so far I've always gotten away with just letting my canvas rest against the back.
customer_reviews.author: D. R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is actually pretty sturdy. It's also lightweight and easy to set up. I haven't painted in a while and decided to start up again. I love that it's so easy to move around and take outside on nicer days.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, portable and adjustable. Great at standing at full length, or on table top. The adjustable height of the bottom rail is my favorite option, since I prefer to paint at eye level. It is sturdy and very adjustable. I did not like that the top hold bracket intrudes on the painting surface, but you can adjust this to clamp down on the canvas edge as an alternative — this is how I use it and it worked great. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Elving Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy and unsteady. Wasn't easy to put my can as and not worry about it toppling over. It's lightweight but super annoying when the canvas doesn't sit properly. Not happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LHD

customer_reviews.title: Expected more, got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.text: I do like all of the aspects of it, except when it is in it's resting position the back leg slides wayyy back. Does not stand as upright as in the photo, causing it to take up more space. Also, not as sturdy as I would've expected. Unless I hold whatever I'm putting in it, it will wobble once I try to write or paint. All in all, unless you're needing something more professional, this should do.
customer_reviews.author: AE87

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy but i guess it works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for someone only after reading the description & reviews. I was disappointed when I got it because it seems much more cheaply made than I thought it would be. The person I got it for has used it but I'm sure you wouldn't dare take this outside to use on a day with the slightest breeze... also there are no instructions on assembly which I find to be terrible customer relations.
customer_reviews.author: Chanel

customer_reviews.title: Performs ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little unstable. Also a little front heavy. Biggest complaint is the was it clamps at the top of the canvas. For a cheap easel, it works ok. Very lightweight. Would probably work great for a sign holder.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Its really light weight and portable.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I've been pleased. And it breaks down into it little carrying case. Put it in my bag and its ready for the next event. Its great for table top. I don't like tray or how it attaches to the easel. Frankly this is better as a table top easel, than for the floor. I've used it nearly weekly for a couple of years. So far its holding up pretty well. THAT I cannot complain about.
customer_reviews.author: CaroleC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: After a while depending on how often you use this easel, the back leg becomes less sturdy over time. If you paint frequently or are a passionate artist, I recommend something stronger. If you paint occasionally or as a hobby/ stress reliever, this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but affordable
customer_reviews.text: This thing ought to have come with instructions. If it weren't for Jasmine K's pictures I would've returned it. It's not intuitive b/c I initially put it together like that video. I hope that poor person discovered Jasmine's photos b/c now it makes more sense. The thing is pretty flimsy but it gets the job done. If you want a "high quality" easel I wouldn't use it but if you want it to hold something static it probably works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Yang

customer_reviews.title: works, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: works but, wish I bought 72" for longer middle pole to make more secure with my 16 x 20 frames(come out of slot). Came with bag with shoulder strap. Easy set up. Can use on table or floor.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the first one of these for my 10 year old daughter and the second for my niece. We have been very happy with this product, it's easy to work with, stable, and durable. I love that it folds up so well and comes with a storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! This is a cheap and flimsy product. Yes, it is lightweight but maybe it's too lightweight. It can barely hold a light framed canvas. The tripod legs slide apart easily and with minimal touch or a nudge the whole thing tips over. I held on to it hoping maybe i can fix the problem somehow but there's nothing I can do to make it stable and sturdy. I regret buying it. I just wish i returned it when I had the chance.
customer_reviews.author: josette

customer_reviews.title: Too light to paint on...disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This easel is very light causing it to move around when painting on it. I got this as a gift for my boyfriend and he tried painting outside and the wind pushed over the whole thing and got his painted canvas that he worked hard on dirty. Also, the clip at the top is difficult to clip onto the canvas. It doesn’t do it’s job of keeping the canvas still. I am pretty disappointed with this product. However, the seller gave me a full refund so I will give 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Good value but a pain to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with any directions. Had to google and YouTube how to get this assembled. Once assembled it was great and pretty sturdy, does wobble a bit from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly O

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight easel
customer_reviews.text: I used this easel a couple of times and it is very easy to setup. The adjustable leg and foot pads are convenient especially when you are out. I like the most of this easel is the light weight. It comes with a bag, so you can easily carry it. I hope I can go out for painting more in the near future. By the way, the instruction inside the package is not as good as the one on the product description here on Amazon. I like the illustration better.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cost for the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love it - can't beat it for the price. I'm a beginner painter and upgrading from duct taping my canvas to a ladder. I went to Michael's and something similar looking cost $79.99' It's extremely light weight and pretty sturdy once you get everything adjusted properly. Taking off one star because I had to go online to find the instructions and didn't get it fully set up until I read a helpful review.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: ... others' reviews as I was particularly interested in how sturdy the stand was b/c I have a 3'x2' white ...
customer_reviews.text: I was going by others' reviews as I was particularly interested in how sturdy the stand was b/c I have a 3'x2' white board. it looks good but the minute I go to erase something, the stand moves all over the place. It is well constructed and would work for lighter materials but for my needs, I'm glad I only paid $16. Better luck next time!
customer_reviews.author: Jill D.

customer_reviews.title: Too lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive but unstable. Would only use with a very light canvas If you plan on using more than once invest in sturdier easel.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Gal

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: So, this is great for on the go paintings of medium to small canvas! It’s ability to fit compact in a small bag is amazing! I don’t recommend for big canvas which is why I gave it 4 stars, I notice it wobbles a bit but again... small to medium size it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Leiline

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive price
customer_reviews.text: Great price for 4-Pack. Lighter than expected. Good for lightweight directional signs and posters. Carry bag is a nice touch. Be VERY aware...these are light and not made for heavy objects. Other than that, they work.
customer_reviews.author: RMP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Bob Ross Parties!
customer_reviews.text: I hosted a Bob Ross Painting Party and recommended my attendees bring this easel for easier painting. Sets up fast and secures the painting easily! For the price you can't beat it! Will use this again and again!
customer_reviews.author: Farrah Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I like to paint while sitting on the floor lately and have had trouble holding my canvas at a good height/angle while painting. Problem solved! It securely holds the canvas as low as you'd like and it appears to have the ability to become quite tall, as well. It looks great! Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: I like the easel very much
customer_reviews.text: I like the easel very much. It is lightweight, seems well-made, easy to adjust the legs, etc. I would have given it five stars had it been able to accommodate larger canvases/poster board. It would be super if the tray holders could be snapped off/on and moved anywhere on the legs with a longer tray to accommodate larger items.
customer_reviews.author: Arleen Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have to have a weight on the feet of the stand to keep it from moving. It's extremely light weight so it is definitely not the most sturdy. But for the money it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: stelios

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my daughter. She said its perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my daughter who loves to paint. Thought this would be a big inprovement, instead of trying to prop up a canvas on a chair and hope it stays. She just loves it and for the price I love it even more.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This is a flimsy piece of junk. You get what you pay for. I discovered this when it was to late to send back or I would have returned it. I'm just using it for a static display tool. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane Rico

customer_reviews.title: in a word . . . FLIMSY
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. If you look up flimsy in the dictionary, there is probably a picture of this easel. The legs bow under their own weight and the lower support for the canvas is razor thin. I'm not sure what rocket scientist thought it would be a good idea to make a portable, collapsible easel but require a screwdriver to set it up. I do like the upper clamp part, that is a nice touch, again very flimsy, but functional. I will continue to use it until I get something better but it is so wobbly it will probably not see the light of day too often.
customer_reviews.author: David J Carter Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality and value way higher than what I expected. It adjusts to fit most sizes, which is great and it's pretty steady and light to carry. Love the little bag it comes in for easy storage. Impressed with the apparent willingness of the seller to make things right if they aren't.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not amazing
customer_reviews.text: We have to recognize price vs quality, this is a very affordable easel. My only complaint is that the canvas adjuster's minimum size is quite large. Lightweight af, easy af to assemble, sturdiness i'm sure would be better if I had the proper size canvas but right now my 11x14 canvas's slide back and forth with my brush strokes. I don't hate it, and I don't love it, we be coexisting.
customer_reviews.author: MesoMayso

customer_reviews.title: Goods for taking pics and painting
customer_reviews.text: Good for taking pics of my art. Also great for painting large images, that way I don’t dirty or take up space on my desk when it’s drying. Easy to assemble and good for storing if you don’t need an easel constantly or don’t have the space for one of the large wood ones.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed w/Artist Easel
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use for my home classroom to prop up charts, white board or med size cork board. Back leg bent at top joint now the legs fan out too wide and it tips over. Only in the 4th week of school. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: H T

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Love that my daughter can stand this on the floor, set it on a desk, or tuck it in a small crevice out of sight when not in use. Sturdy, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.E

customer_reviews.title: Good product but with a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: It is a pretty good easel that can adjust to different heights and canvas sizes easily. But the clip on top is not a great way to keep things from falling and the overall apparatus can also tumble pretty easily. Not kid friendly because of that reason either
customer_reviews.author: ValueBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I spected
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and I believe that it would be the one I need. But is to light in weigh and doesn't keep in place, frame doesn't hold it because the piece the holds it doesn't have enough pressure, keep falling all the time. I think I will returned it.
customer_reviews.author: nuvia

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy
customer_reviews.text: I like the flexibility of this stand. I gave it a 5 rating on studiousness because it is what I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: George D

customer_reviews.title: Weak and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Super flimsy. Couldn’t hold the weight of the picture without bending the bottom support. Poor design and weak
customer_reviews.author: G Uke Texas

customer_reviews.title: it'll probably be very useful for you
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. However, I got it to paint with oil paints and it's a little too flimsy to stand up to how hard I need to press on the canvas. If you're not using oils, it'll probably be very useful for you. I ended up giving this to my niece and nephew to use with their acrylics.
customer_reviews.author: Luna Starshine

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Since it is lightweight, it is not so sturdy, but it doesn't push over easily. After a rousing game of Pictionary with middle schoolers and adults, it stayed right in place. A wonderful value!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great little piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! It was easy to use and so practical with all the bells and whistles that I needed. Yes, the easel is not heavy but I didn't want heavy equipment and didn't need it for the purpose that it would serve. I used it indoors to hold a three fold cardboard display and it was perfect. I am so happy that I ordered two because they are a great bargain at this price and I know that I will use it again soon!
customer_reviews.author: shirley

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I’d expected
customer_reviews.text: This wasn’t easy to put together. It wasn’t strong enough or wide enough for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Timmelmik
